sentence: 내가 짧게나마 환음사(歡音寺)에 머물고 있던 때였다.
here: It was the time when, short though it was, I stayed at Hwanum Temple.
gloss: although it is (only the likes of)...; at least, anyway; even.

here: I was intending to translate a book...
gloss: wanting to; ready / prepared / willing to; intending to, going to.

here: Hwanŭm temple, no different from a rundown temple...
gloss: is no different from a NOUN.

here: It couldn’t have pleased me more.
gloss: This pattern is similar in effect to the pattern 여간 + NEGATIVE (or implied negative) meaning very; not a little, to no small extent, quite, extremely, terribly.

here: First of all, in so far as traffic was inconvenient...
gloss: in as much as, in so far as, since.

here: ...the temple’s influence had waned...
gloss: Naked infinitive abbreviated from -어(서).

here: ...the [only] face of the monk that one had to confront...
gloss: = NOUN이라고[는]: the only NOUN [as topic]; as for NOUN ... (usually followed by a negative).

here: ... was only to the point of [=nothing more than] the head monk of the temple...
gloss: is [only] to the extent that...; is to the point that…

sentence: 유유자적할 수 있다는 게 무엇보다 좋았다.
here: ...the best part of it was that I could live a carefree life.
gloss: The best part of it was the fact that...

here: ...because there was none second to its beauty...
gloss: Although the Korean spelling somewhat obscures the origin, this is a substantive in -(으)ㅁ + instrumental (으)로(서), and means with (as, etc.) the doing or being; since (because of) the doing or being. Note also -기 짝이 없다 be incredibly/unbelievably...

sentence: 환상적 절간 구색은 모두 갖추고 있는 셈이었다.
here: It seemed like the dreamy temple had it all.
gloss: (lit.): the calculation, conjecture, supposition; accounting (for) is that …; (judgment based on) appearances, to all appearances/indications, that one might call …

here: here and there throughout
gloss: Here and there, everywhere, all over. Reduplication for distributive effect. Cf. also 곳곳이, 집집이...

here: ...significantly out of the way...
gloss: Naked infinitive abbreviated from -어(서).

here: The temple seemed to be concealed by mountains on all four sides.
gloss: the calculation, conjecture, supposition; accounting (for) is that …; (judgment based on) appearances, to all appearances/indications, that one might call …

here: ...going around the mountain bend...
gloss: Although the Korean spelling somewhat obscures the origin, this is a substantive in -(으)ㅁ + instrumental (으)로(서) , and means with (as, etc.) the doing or being; since (because of) the doing or being.

here: ...because of the flower fragrance drifting up from all directions...
gloss: (cause) for, because, since, from, on account of…

here: ...it was a situation in which one’s head would hurt and one’s breathing obstructed.
gloss: is the (rather pathetic or undesirable) situation/condition/circumstance of... (alternatively: -(으)ㄹ지경으로).

here: ...because it was such a cold temple bereft of visitors,...
gloss: Naked infinitive -(이)라(서), on the alternate form for the infinitive of the copula –이다, -이어(서).

here: ...its’s manner was different from that of a fancy temple.
gloss: is not in the manner of NOUN, is a style different from NOUN, is in a different league from NOUN.

here: ...weeds and dilapidated frescos...
gloss: NOUN1  and/or NOUN2.

here: ...the cracking mud walls, the creaking wooden floors, etc... .
gloss: etc., and the like, and so on; the above several; sometimes also used to round off a list or enumeration of things.

here: ...devotees and students preparing for the bar exams...
gloss: NOUN1  and/or NOUN2.

here: ...come right up to the courtyard of the temple, and...
gloss: Naked infinitive from -어(서).

here: ...enjoyed meandering.
gloss: likes to VERB... . enjoys VERB ing...

here: because the closest village was Pyengok village, ...
gloss: from -(이)라[고] 해서: because they say/it was said that …

here: ...Even with my fast walking pace...
gloss: even with/by means of.

here: …live, tilling and cultivating the rice paddies and steppes.
gloss: short form of -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: …a kind of anxiety and frustration from Seoul…
gloss: substantive -(으)ㅁ the act (or fact) of having / being.

here: …I did not feel it even once when I was up in the mountains.
gloss: The addition of 를 to –지 in the long form negation pattern with 못하다 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern in -지 않다.

here: …the moment you open the door …
gloss: the moment you VERB…no sooner than one VERBs, that…; as soon as one…

here: …not only was it possible to see flowers, (but in addition…)
gloss: from -었는데(에) + -다가 not only did...but in addition (on top of that).

sentence: 그렇게 아득하게 여겨질 수가 없었던 것이다.
here: …seemed extremely distant.
gloss: Similar in effect to 여간 + NEGATIVE (or implied negative) meaning very; not a little, to no small extent, quite, extremely, terribly. Note also -어 지다: besides meaning gets to be or becomes with adjectives, this can have the effect of a "get-passive" in English or of middles or reflexives in languages which have these. The implication is that the subject/agent is either (sometimes adversely) affected by the action, and/or has no control over the action of the verb.

sentence: 이런 자연 풍광에 몸을 적시고 보면
here: …once one immerses one’s body in natures scenery…
gloss: Similar to –다 보면 if one does something over a period of time [and then steps back to reflect on it]...; if you do something for a while, then...

here: …even for one season…
gloss: although it is (only the likes of)…; at least, anyway; even.

here: To think that there are still such Utopias left on this earth…
gloss: Tsk-tsk pattern: to think that...!, just imagine!, can you believe it?!, whooda thunk that?!

here: …it feels as if it is, after all, blessedly lucky for us.
gloss: it feels like, as if maybe; think to oneself that...

here: …if it is the tiger of my dreams, the mythological tiger…
gloss: from -(이)라(고) 하면 if it (be said to be) be…, if it were (the case) that…More putative/hypothetical than -이면.

sentence: 산이 제 아무리 높고 깊으며 산령(山靈)이 영험스러워도
here: Now matter how high or deep the mountain, or how miraculous the mountain spirit,…
gloss: no matter how (much one might)…

here: …it is not any different from any old hill…
gloss: be nothing but, be only, merely, be nothing more than a NOUN. Note also 결코 + Negative not VERB at all, not VERB in the least.

here: …as is becoming any mountain…
gloss: substandard version of NOUN답게 in a way that is like, worth being, worthy of the name; in a way becoming to or every bit a NOUN.

here: …In order to achieve a mountain character…
gloss: From -(으)려[고 하]면: [shape is -려 after vowels and the ㄹ of L-dropping bases] with the thought in mind to do, with the intention of doing, with the desire to do; ready (prepared, willing) to do. In colloquial Korean, is often rendered -(으)ㄹ라고 하다.

here: secretly (hiding)
gloss: adverb from -스럽다 in a … manner.

here: …it had to be a mountain that is secretly hiding a savage beast.
gloss: alternate from of -이어야 했다 had to be.

here: …it might be that I am the only one with this empty dream, I thought to myself.
gloss: prospective assertive: will probably be/do (usually as an inner thought, or else in an indirect quotation).

here: If my fantasy runs deep…
gloss: from –다[고 하]면: more hypothetical conditional than plain -(으)면.

here: Granted there are beasts larger than the tiger,…
gloss: [lit.] granted that, even though it is or does [often followed by a rhetorical question].

here: …just like/ just as a spiritual mountain monk, I…
gloss: is like, is as (if) with 듯 added directly to the verb stem. Martin treats this as an abbreviation of the pattern where 듯 is used as a post-modifier, i.e. -(으)ㄴ 듯, -(으)ㄹ 듯, -는 듯; but in any case you should keep them distinct.

sentence: 꿈을 꿈으로만 만족할 수 없을 만큼
here: …to the extent that I couldn’t be satisfied with only a dream…
gloss: to the extent that will do/be (= -(으)ㄹ 정도(로) ); enough to do, as much as necessary for doing.

here: …including even faint candle-light…
gloss: going to the extreme/limit of; (including) even; including (even the extreme case of); also (on top of everything/everyone else); with all the rest.

here: …the [sounds] approaching from the forest…
gloss: gradually (comes in doing); comes up (along); starts (has started) becoming / doing; has/had been doing.

here: …sounds eerie enough to instill fear…
gloss: sufficient (to do); is well worth (doing); is at the point (of doing), has reached the stage (when it can do).

here: …they call for and answer each other.
gloss: each other. Nice example of 서로 + 를.

here: The mountain beasts come out of the forest, and…
gloss: Naked infinitive -어(서).

here: …cross over the walls and frolic in the empty field.
gloss: beyond, over, the other side (of something tall / high); over = more than, in excess of; beyond.

sentence: 마치 내 방 앞을 달리는 듯한
here: …just as if they were running around outside my window…
gloss: like, as, giving the appearance of ...; appearing (to be), looking (like); seeming as if; as if/though. Adverb 마치 signals that a 듯(이 ) or 처럼 is coming up.

here: …listening to the sounds of their pattering feet, I…
gloss: for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: …the sounds of their rough, well-sized footsteps…
gloss: it is/seems likely to be / do), it is possible/acceptable to (do), it is all right to (do); it is acceptably (rather/somewhat/quite…; it is worth doing = (-(으)ㄹ만 하다).

here: …whenever I heard…
gloss: whenever….every time…

sentence: 내 방 호마이카상 위에 켜진 촛불마저도
here: Even the candle light on top of the formaica table in my room…
gloss: going to the extreme/limit of; (including) even; including (even the extreme case of); also (on top of everything/everyone else); with all the rest. Adding 도 reinforces the ‘even’.

here: …die out and flutter thinly.
gloss: Naked infinitive -어(서).

here: …almost without exception…
gloss: (in a way) so that, so that it is or does; so that one can; in a manner such that;-ly.

here: …went as far as taking Mr. Ha the drunkard along…
gloss: even, so far as (extent, emphasis); up to and including.

here: [on top of a sturdy physique] not typical for his age,…
gloss: from -답지 않게 in a manner unbecoming of / unfitting for…

here: …on top of a sturdy physique not typical for his age,…
gloss: on top of, in addition to, thrown into the bargain (에 + copula transferentive -(이)다(가)).

sentence: 손끝 하나 움직이질 못한다는 하 씨는
here: Mr. Ha, who couldn’t budge a finger..
gloss: shows dissatisfaction with or displeasure at the negated processive verb.

here: …despite of the fact that he was barely past forty…
gloss: given the circumstance that it is/does, even though, though. Can usually be taken as an abbreviation of -었는데도 불구하고 in spite of the fact that did….

here: a shyness beyond measure
gloss: the act (or fact) of having / being.

here: ….sat on the ridge between the paddies…
gloss: Naked infinitive -어(서).

here: …came out to the fields in order to take a walk…
gloss: by way of, for, for the sake of, as NOUN. From 삼다 to make something of (a person or a thing).

here: …showing great joy, they called out to me.
gloss: for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: Mr. Yang, who invited me along for a drink…
gloss: from -자[고 하]는 saying/suggesting ‘let’s …’.

here: … it had indeed been such a long time since…
gloss: so very much indeed, ever so (hard).

here: …because it was [such a long time since I had tasted] alcohol…
gloss: Naked copular infinitive, alternate form for –이어(서) .

here: I picked up a stone…
gloss: Naked infinitive (주워(서) ← 줍다/줏더).

here: …a pure drink brewed only of corn…
gloss: only of….only from…only to…, by means of only…

here: …filled up to the top, but…
gloss: Naked infinitive -어(서)

here: …gradually emptying out…
gloss: gradually (goes on doing); keeps growing (getting to be, becoming). Note also -(으)ㄴ다며 for -(으)ㄴ다[고 하]며 = -(으)ㄴ다[고 하]면서

sentence: 내게 강냉이술이 얼마나 몸에 좋은가를 설명했다.
here: He explained to me how good corn brew is for one’s health.
gloss: explains about how…

here: …in conformity with his excited voice…
gloss: in accordance with, in conformity to (with), according to.

here: …were fidgeting busily.
gloss: Besides meaning gets to be or becomes with adjectives, -어 지다 can have the effect of a "get-passive" in English or of middles or reflexives in languages which have these. The implication is that the subject/agent is either (sometimes adversely) affected by the action, and/or has no control over the action of the verb.

here: …a drinking table without even a piece of sour kimchi…
gloss: even, too, to boot, in addition, into the bargain.

here: …just as they told me…
gloss: as, just as, just as it is (was); in accordance with.

sentence: 술 맛이 그렇게 달고 부드러울 수가 없었다
here: The drink was extremely sweet and smooth.
gloss: This pattern is similar in effect to the pattern 여간 + NEGATIVE (or implied negative) meaning very; not a little, to no small extent, quite, extremely, terribly.

here: …just like [a woman] causing the menfolk to get excited…
gloss: the group, all of…This makes an explicit plural for nouns referring to people; it is also used in combination with the synonyms 들 and 끼리: 우리, 우리네, 우리들, 우리네들, 우리들네 we/us.

here: …just like [a woman] causing the menfolk to get excited…
gloss: does like, does as (if) with -듯(이) attached directly to the verb stem. Martin treats this as an abbreviation of the pattern where 듯 is used as a post-modifier, i.e. -(으)ㄴ 듯, -(으)ㄹ 듯, -는 듯; but in any case you should keep them distinct.

sentence: 설탕 한 알 들지 않았다는 곡주
here: The brew, which they said did not contain even a single grain of sugar…
gloss: for -았다[고 하]는.

here: The body, heating up as if on fire…
gloss: does like, does as (if) with -듯(이) attached directly to the verb stem. Martin treats this as an abbreviation of the pattern where 듯 is used as a post-modifier, i.e. -(으)ㄴ 듯, -(으)ㄹ 듯, -는 듯; but in any case you should keep them distinct.

here: …how beautiful!
gloss: It was so … (as I recall)!! I.e., oblique question in 지 on a retrospective modifier in –던.

here: …the pure blue sky spread over the mountain ridge…
gloss: The pattern in infinitive -어 + 지다, besides meaning gets to be or becomes with adjectives, can have the effect of a "get-passive" in English or of middles or reflexives in languages which have these. The implication is that the subject/agent is either (sometimes adversely) affected by the action, and/or has no control over the action of the verb.

sentence: 어느 것 하나 나 혼자 보기 아깝지 않은 게 없었다.
here: …it was a shame to see it all by myself.
gloss: it is a shame to…it is a pity to…

sentence: 여자애가 바로 옆에 앉아 있기만 하다면
here: …if only I had a sweetheart sitting right across from me…
gloss: if one only does/is or were to do/be. With -다면, more hypothetical than plain -(으)면.

here: …an intoxication that is worthy of a good cry…
gloss: is sufficient (to do), is well worth (doing); is at the point (of doing), has reached the stage (when one can do). Note also the ‘cognate object’ pattern in 을음 울다. Cf. 잠(을)자-, 춤(을) 추-, 꿈(을) 꾸-.

here: …there is also a tiger, I tell you.
gloss: 말이야, 말입니다, etc. can follow a QUOTE + verb of saying + modifier as a kind of post-modifier, and means it is to say = I mean, you know, you see, uh, that is, etc.

here: …my story of/about hearing the footsteps of a tiger…
gloss: for -었다[고 하]는.

here: (contrary to what you might believe), they say there are dragons and elephants too!
gloss: ends a sentence with the meaning 'indeed', or 'despite contrary anticipations/reservations'.

here: …Mr. Yang, letting out a short laugh…
gloss: abbreviated version of -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: Hey!...
gloss: plain/intimate style vocative: Hey! Say! Oh!

here: …[the booze seemed to be] no more than a drink of cold water [to him].
gloss: is nothing but, is only, merely, is nothing more than a…

here: …sending the children away to the big city…
gloss: Naked infinitive -어(서).

here: …going from place to place alone dragging his cow with him…
gloss: short version of -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: …no more than the basic show of goodwill…
gloss: 1. more than, above and beyond, over, upward of NOUN. 2. beyond, past, more than NOUN; further than NOUN. 3. since, now that, seeing that. 3. that is all, that is the end.

here: …(in a state of) not showing any particular interest…
gloss: just as it is or did, (in) the original state of…

here: lit. he slowly began to participate in my world of interests. (He began to fascinate me).
gloss: gradually (comes in doing); comes up (along); starts (has started) becoming / doing; has/had been doing.

here: …My question as to whether or not a tiger exists…
gloss: The question as to whether…

here: …a confidence no more than what is necessary…
gloss: 1. more than, above and beyond, over, upward of NOUN. 2. beyond, past, more than NOUN; further than NOUN. 3. since, now that, seeing that. 3. that is all, that is the end.

here: I did see [the tiger’s] footprints clearly with my very own eyes.
gloss: (exclamatory) sure(ly), indeed, quite. Used to offer a kind of follow-up explanation to what has just been said (or implied). Also functions as a sort of politeness strategy to keep conversations moving by inviting a response (notice that it usually has a rising, question-like intonation).

here: …they don’t appear easily to human eyes.
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 in the long form negation pattern is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration.

here: …always kept hidden…
gloss: just as it is or did, (in) the original state of…

here: …because they move around only in the deep of night…
gloss: because of …ing.

here: …because he lived in the mountains his whole life…
gloss: although the Korean spelling somewhat obscures the origin, this is a substantive in -(으)ㅁ + instrumental (으)로(서) , and means with (as, etc.) the doing or being; since (because of) the doing or being.

here: …not only could he tell the different between…but…
gloss: not only..., but (also)...; furthermore; as well as; besides, in addition, on top of that.

here: …speaking to the point of wearing out one’s mouth; speaking profusely…
gloss: projective: to the point where, until (a result); so that.

here: praised him ceaselessly.
gloss: does something to no end; does something ceaselessly/endlessly.

here: …Our Mr. Yang, he is indeed…
gloss: it is indeed/precisely NOUN that…

here: …is certainly the most recognized hunter…
gloss: of course, certainly, surely is/does.

here: …even while he sleeps…
gloss: even while, even in the midst of …ing (transferentive -다가 indicating a change or shift of action or state plus particle 도).

here: …appealing to my enebriation…
gloss: invoking NOUN, relying on, appealing to…

sentence: 얼마나 큰 일이고 횡재할 일인가를 설명해 주었다.
here: …I explained what a big deal it is and what an unexpected fortune.
gloss: to explain about WH-…, to go on about WH-…

here: …not to mention the big newspapers in Seoul, but also…
gloss: not to mention NOUN; also NOUN, to be sure.

here: …there is a craze of attempting to discover tigers…
gloss: is frantic trying to…

here: If only you could find a tiger…
gloss: if only… More hypothetical than plain -(으)면.

here: …eyes twinkling, he stared at me.
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: …even the uproar concerning the fake tiger…
gloss: even, too, to boot, in addition, into the bargain.

here: …he had no way of knowing.
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 in the long negation patterns is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to.

here: Of course it’s the truth.
gloss: of course, certainly, sure (here on copula -이-).

here: …if only the fact that there is a tiger is confirmed…
gloss: if only… More hypothetical than plain -(으)면.

here: …even it were right here and now…
gloss: (1) even if (it be); (2) just, (or the ) like ( = 이나 ); or even; any, some.

here: …I’ll certainly come forward.
gloss: of course, certainly, sure.

here: …had he said “let’s go for it”,…
gloss: For -자[고 하]면 if one suggests…

here: ....I’d drop the translation and everything and…
gloss: you can say what you like about NOUN and stuff, but...; NOUN, schmoun…

here: …I was in the mood to follow him.
gloss: it was a… mood, in the mood to…, feel like …ing.

sentence: 산길을 더듬을 수 없을 뿐만 아니라
here: …not only was it impossible to grope through the mountain pass, but...
gloss: not only..., but (also)...; furthermore; as well as; besides, in addition, on top of that.

here: …together with a Japanese hunter…
gloss: together with NOUN, along with NOUN.

here: …he said that after only two days, he followed and caught a tiger.
gloss: after only (marks passage of time); within, after a passage of…

here: …When I found the tiger’s tracks, then…
gloss: For -고는. Placing the 는 after -고 in -고는 forces the “and [then]...” reading of -고, as opposed to the “and [also]…” reading. In other words, it means “when..., ...then; upon doing,” but emphasizing the consequence.

here: Mr. Yang said, again and again.
gloss: abbreviation for 나에게.

here: ….chased by hunting howls…
gloss: To mark the (inanimate) agent of a passive. I.e., 에 marks the ‘by’-phrase in a passive construction.

sentence: 그 순간 그가 떠올리고 있었음이 분명했다.
here: …at that moment, it was clear that he was conjuring up [the image].
gloss: it is clear that….it is obvious that…

sentence: 원고지 한 장에 천 원도 치어지지 않는 고료
here: …a fee which came to no more than one thousand won a page…
gloss: The pattern in infinitive -어 + 지다, besides meaning gets to be or becomes with adjectives, can have the effect of a "get-passive" in English or of middles or reflexives in languages which have these. The implication is that the subject/agent is either (sometimes adversely) affected by the action, and/or has no control over the action of the verb.

sentence: 내 전신을 흥건히 적셔 왔던 것이다.
here: …my entire body was gradually being drowned.
gloss: gradually (comes in doing); comes up (along); starts (has started) becoming/doing; has/had been doing.

here: …I kept on conjuring up mountains and valleys.
gloss: abbreviated from -고는 하다: makes a habit/regular practice (a regular thing) of doing it; does it from time to time.

here: …hiding itself…
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

sentence: 어느 누구에게도 제 모습을 내보이지 않으면서도
here: …while not showing itself to anyone…
gloss: to anyone, to any which person.

here: …lit. could not be his fear (he feared none of those).
gloss: cannot be NOUN... is not possible that it is NOUN.

sentence: 그것이 그의 가장 큰 두려움일 뿐이었다.
here: …that was his only main fear.
gloss: is nothing but, only, constantly; all it/one does/is is…

here: …is not sufficient, and…
gloss: abbreviated from 하지 아니하다 is not; does not…

sentence: 나의 환상을 실제화 시키고자 하는 욕망이었다.
here: …it was my thirst to make my illusion a reality.
gloss: wants to; is ready/prepared/willing to; intends to.

here: …even those friends who knew what Unhong mountain looked like…
gloss: even, too, to boot, in addition, into the bargain.

sentence: 남쪽에 있는 큰 산 하나에 지나지 않았다.
here: …it was nothing but another big mountain in the south.
gloss: is nothing more than NOUN, is only NOUN, merely NOUN.

here: …they couldn’t even muster up interest in the tiger.
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern. Note also particle 조차(도) even, too, to boot, in addition, into the bargain.

sentence: 관람용 호랑이 생각에서 더 이상 나아가질 않았다.
here: …they did not go past their impression of the tiger as an exhibit…
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern.

here: …they only thoroughly believed the reports…
gloss: did nothing but, only, constantly did; all it/one did is…

here: My frustration getting worse…
gloss: Naked infinitive. Note also 맘 for 마음.

here: …instead of borrowing Mr. Yang’s words…
gloss: instead of...-ing, in place/lieu of…-ing; while on the one hand…

here: …even though K was doubtful…
gloss: Used with descriptive verbs that refer to human feelings (liking, fearing, reacting to,...) when the experiencer is a third person.

here: …only his curiosity was not hidden.
gloss: 만 with 은 denoting contrast. Note also negative preemphasis in -지를 않았다. The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern.

here: …if only you take a picture of the tiger…
gloss: no sooner does it/one do or be, than…; all one/it has to do or be is… (and then some result). Note that -다면 is more hypothetical than plain -(으)면.

here: …[to the effect that one] will end up becoming an historical figure…
gloss: to show final development of an action: ends up doing, finally does, gets around to doing, ultimately does.

here: …my incessant pestering…
gloss: the act of (doing), …ing (sometimes pejorative).

here: [Mr. K and myself] hid out travel plans even from our very homes (families)…
gloss: up to, to plus particle 도 even (renders the delimiter 까지 even more emphatic).

here: …[imagining the shock] we didn’t even get tired and pressed on noisily.
gloss: doesn’t even…

here: …[imagining the shock] we didn’t even get tired and pressed on noisily.
gloss: (does) terribly, awfully, a lot, like mad/anything (gives iterative and/or emphatic force to a preceding verb infinitive).

here: In spite of the fact that it was southerly…
gloss: given the circumstance that it is, even though, though it is. This pattern can usually be taken as an abbreviation of -는데도 불구하고 in spite of the fact that.

sentence: 가을은 우리가 떠나온 곳보다 더욱 깊어 있었다.
here: Autumn was much deeper than the place we had left.
gloss: is in the state of resulting from, is done.

here: …it was covered by the fallen leaves.
gloss: is in the state of resulting from, is done Here on 뒤덮이- be / get covered.

here: …whereas on the one hand, the mountain’s features were even more sharp…
gloss: whereas on the one hand…

here: …the taste of abundance was even more rinsed away.
gloss: resultant state: is in the state of resulting from, is done.

here: …the first person I met was Mr. Ha.
gloss: quasi-free noun and postmodifier 이 a person, a man; one; a thing.

here: …as usual, he was in a state of drunkenness.
gloss: resultant state: is in the state of resulting from, is done.

here: …for quite a while…
gloss: as much as… (implying that the speaker thinks the amount is a lot).

here: …only when he had searched his memory…
gloss: only when… (finally).

here: …it was as if he had completely forgotten.
gloss: is like, is as (if) is like, is as (if).

here: …pointing at K…
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

sentence: 사진을 찍으러 왔다는 얘길 했을 때도
here: …even when I said that he had come to take pictures of the tiger…
gloss: even when; also when.

here: …he looked as if he had no idea what I was talking about.
gloss: gives (shows) indirect signs or hints that…

here: …even his answer was preposterous.
gloss: (order) beginning with; first; starting from.

here: …asking him to go look for Mr. Yang or something…
gloss: or the like, like, or something, or so; the likes of, any; at least, anyway, just (used in gently/vaguely urging way), even if it is not of particular interest.

here: ….just like Mr. Ha had said…
gloss: as, just as, just as it is (was); in accordance with NOUN.

here: …he was (in the state of being) emaciated.
gloss: resultant state: is in the state of resulting from, is done. Note also -던 것이다 it was that case that…

here: …he was very happy to see me.
gloss: very; not a little, to no small extent, quite, extremely, terribly.

here: …the moment I saw his welcoming countenance…
gloss: the moment/instant…

here: …the anxiety I had felt towards Mr. Ha …
gloss: does and then; doing and then.

here: …the anxiety I had felt towards Mr. Ha …
gloss: about (so much), approximately NOUN; NOUN (of a) caliber; so much of, of that extent.

here: …I saw that thing’s footprints clearly, I tell ya.
gloss: used to end a sentence with the meaning 'indeed', or 'despite contrary anticipations/reservations'.

here: …he said that he had been waiting for me.
gloss: makes a solemn proclamation/declaration that ….

here: …he had also scanned over the tiger trail…
gloss: Functions like -고 and. Note also -어 둔다 does something to get it out of the way (perhaps as a precaution); gets it done, finishes it up (so it will be out of the way), does it once and for good, does thoroughly/carefully now (so it will not have to be done again; does for later/future use or reference (similar to -어 놓는다).

here: …I asked because his face looked so anxious.
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: (perhaps because) he alone…
gloss: for 자기 혼자. Korean has at least three levels of reflexive pronoun meaning one’s self: Low 저 Polite 자기 (자신, 자체) Honorific 당신.

here: …perhaps because (he alone) was all disappointed…
gloss: perhaps because… When left hanging in mid-sentence, you can interpret the pattern as having left out a following (도) 모르지만: it may have been the case that or it is uncertain WH... [but...].

here: …don’t worry.
gloss: deletion of [하지] after verbal noun: for 염려 [하지] 말아요.

here: even though it be like this…
gloss: From 이렇- + -어+ 도

here: …if we go after the tiger…
gloss: For 호랑이를.

here: …if we go after the tiger…
gloss: more hypothetical than plain conditional -(으)면.

here: …It will get to the point that I will even be able to fly.
gloss: is to/at the point that… is to the extent that…

here: even though it appears to be like this…
gloss: From 이렇- + -어+ 보여도

here: …Since my bones have hardened…
gloss: as/since it did (somewhat old-fashioned or folksy; equivalent to colloquial -드니, according to Roth).

here: …we decided to venture off in our pursuit.
gloss: shortened from 하기로.

sentence: 양 씨는 술을 끊고 있다 했으므로
here: …because Mr. Yang said that (Mr. Ha) was getting off the wagon…
gloss: Although the Korean spelling somewhat obscures the origin, this is a substantive in -(으)ㅁ + instrumental 로(서), and means with (as, etc.) the doing or being; since (because of) the doing or being. Note also -고 있다 meaning is/continues in a (changed) state. Cf. -어 있다. 병원 에 입원 하고 있다 is in the hospital. 가고 없다 is gone.

here: That gentleman, even when he sleeps,…
gloss: even while, even in the middle of …-ing with -다가 indicating a change or shift of action or state plus particle 도.

here: …as soon as he thinks of tigers…
gloss: no sooner does it/one do or be, than…; as soon as… then…

here: …after the first time you left…
gloss: after …ing; ever since …ing.

here: …not saying a word about tigers, now…
gloss: as now it has been observed that...; when (now/then); since (now/then)...; ...and now/then; ...but now/then. Usually implies a marked or abrupt contrast between the first and second clauses: whereupon. Note also deletion of [하지] after verbal noun: 얘길 않- for 얘길 [하지] 않-.

here: …ever since he got sick…
gloss: abbreviation of -(으)면서부터 ever since...-ing; starting from the time when...

here: …all of a sudden he says that he is looking for tigers.
gloss: abbreviated from of adverb -스러이 in a way that is like…, in a way typical of …. from -스럽다.

here: …Mr. Yang, indeed…
gloss: only if it be; if (it be), when it comes to; even, indeed. (Marks a reinforced contingency or prerequisite for a main clause, one or the other of which is unlikely, unexpected, or anticipated to be difficult or unpleasant). Can be treated as a shortened form of NOUN이야말로.

here: …from the very outset he was a farmer (and not something else)…
gloss: Followed by an emphatic, pregnant pause; it is most emphatically the case that… [and not something else].

here: …since when did he become a beast-chasing chaser and hunter? (i.e. he was never one.)
gloss: abbreviated from –이고 after a vowel.

here: …because he goes on and on about tigers…
gloss: (does) terribly, awfully, a lot, like mad/anything (gives iterative and/or emphatic force to a preceding verb infinitive).

here: …gathered the autumn harvest, and…
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: …after he lost his wife…
gloss: after …ing; ever since …ing.

here: …guests…
gloss: the group, all of… Makes an explicit plural for nouns referring to people; it is also used in combination with the synonyms 들 and 끼리: 우리, 우리네, 우리들, 우리네들, 우리들네 we/us.

here: …repeatedly empting his glass…
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

sentence: 양 씨가 왜 그리 나를 반기던가를 생각했다.
here: ….I wondered why Mr. Yang was so happy to see me.
gloss: as object: wonders why it was the case that…

here: …in a way unbefitting one’s age…
gloss: from 맞지 않게, with adverbial -게: (in a way) so that, so that it is or does; so that one can; in a manner such that; -ly.

sentence: 제 아내를 잃은 듯 섭섭해 했다.
here: …he looked as sad as though it was his own wife he had lost.
gloss: Used with descriptive verbs that refer to human feelings (liking, fearing, reacting to,...) when the experiencer is a third person. Note also 제, the low version of Plain 자기.

here: …the runaway wife…
gloss: the group, all of… Makes an explicit plural for nouns referring to people; it is also used in combination with the synonyms 들 and 끼리: 우리, 우리네, 우리들, 우리네들, 우리들네 we/us.

here: …I felt my dedication collapsing.
gloss: feels sth …ing with substantive -(으)ㅁ the act (or fact) of having/being.

sentence: 모두 나 때문인 듯이 여겨졌던 것이다.
here: …it felt as though it were somehow all my fault.
gloss: feels as if, reckons it is as if …. Note also -어 진다: besides meaning gets to be or becomes with adjectives, can have the effect of a "get-passive" in English or of middles or reflexives in languages which have these. The implication is that the subject/agent is either (sometimes adversely) affected by the action, and/or has no control over the action of the verb.

here: …in accordance with Mr. Yang’s exhaustion…
gloss: in accordance with NOUN, in conformity to (with) NOUN, according to NOUN. Here on a substantive in -(으)ㅁ: the act (or fact) of having/being.

here: …even the tiger in the heart of the mountain…
gloss: even NOUN, NOUN too, NOUN to boot, NOUN in addition, NOUN into the bargain.

here: …pulling up a wooden chair…
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: …he believes that you will keep your promise, I tell you.
gloss: colloquial reduction of 것이라고요.

here: …even a good sum of money…
gloss: (1) even if (it be); (2) just, (or the ) like ( = 이나); or even; any, some.

here: …of course we will keep the promise.
gloss: of course, certainly, sure.

here: …K and I, lagging behind…
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: …on account of the forest and fog…
gloss: on account of NOUN.

here: ….our field of vision was blocked even for 20-30 meters ahead.
gloss: The addition of 를 to –지 in the long negation pattern is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration.

here: lit. …no one opened their mouth (no one spoke a word).
gloss: a person, a man; one; a thing.

here: …somewhere [or other]…
gloss: From 어디에 + -인가에.

here: …clearing away the dead leaves, he took the lead.
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously

here: …even about ten days ago…
gloss: about approximately; to/at/in…also/even/either.

here: …sitting on a bare tree stump…
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: …as if you were setting off to look for mountain ginsaeng.
gloss: like, as, giving the appearance of...; appearing (to be), looking (like); seeming as if; as if/though..

here: …I did not take my words back, and…
gloss: Deletion of [하지] after verbal noun: for 부인[하지] 않고.

here: despite having wandered for the better part of the day…
gloss: given the circumstance that it is/does, even though, though. This pattern can usually be taken as an abbreviation of -는데도 불구하고 in spite of the fact that.

here: …we didn’t even find a footprint of a wild boar.
gloss: : The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation patterns.

here: …the fog peeled off as if it had been rinsed away.
gloss: like, as, giving the appearance of ...; appearing (to be), looking (like); seeming as if; as if/though.. Note also -어 지-. Also -어 진다: besides meaning gets to be or becomes with adjectives, can have the effect of a "get-passive" in English or of middles or reflexives in languages which have these. The implication is that the subject/agent is either (sometimes adversely) affected by the action, and/or has no control over the action of the verb.

here: …even though we had wandered the whole day…
gloss: given the circumstance that it is/does, even though, though. This pattern can usually be taken as an abbreviation of -는데도 불구하고 in spite of the fact that.

sentence: 노루 두 마리만 카메라에 담았을 뿐이었다.
here: …all he caught in his camera were two roe deer.
gloss: nothing but, only, constantly; all it/one does/is (or did / was) is…

here: …I was not disappointed in the least.
gloss: not VERB at all, not VERB in the least.

here: …through Mr. Yang’s fervent glance…
gloss: through/by way of NOUN.

here: …I came to feel the tiger’s existence as infallibly real.
gloss: Besides meaning gets to be or becomes with adjectives, can have the effect of a "get-passive" in English or of middles or reflexives in languages which have these. The implication is that the subject/agent is either (sometimes adversely) affected by the action, and/or has no control over the action of the verb.

here: …he was humming a tune, when…
gloss: Makes iterative mimetics. More insistent and prolonged than mimetic + -거리다: does repeatedly/continuously; does and does; keeps doing, does on and on, does (keeps doing) it away; does again and again, does over and over again.

here: …leaning on a boulder…
gloss: just as it is or did, (in) the original state of…

here: …not even blinking…
gloss: Deletion of [하지] after verbal noun: 깜짝 [하지] 않고.

here: …why don’t you close your eyes just for a moment?
gloss: (1) even if (it be); (2) just, (or the) like ( = 이나); or even; any, some.

here: …smiling a thin smile, he…
gloss: just as it is or did, (in) the original state of…

sentence: 여태껏 그가 아내 생각을 하고 있었음을 알았다.
here: I knew that all this time he had been thinking about his wife.
gloss: to know that… to realize that… on substantive -(으)ㅁ the act (or fact) of having/being.

here: …I wouldn’t say that she was pretty, but rather…
gloss: it’s not so much that A, but rather… (abbreviated from –다[고 하]기보다). Cf. also -ㄴ다기보다, -는다기보다, -(이)라기보다.

sentence: 이런 산골에 처박혀있기엔 아무래도 과했던 그년이
here: …that girl, for whom it was too much to be stuck here in this kind of mountain village…
gloss: for/in/by/from having done.

here: lit. on account of her having seen what?
gloss: have seen what? = for what reason?

here: …she couldn’t find a source of strength, and so…
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: …her taking-off was to be expected.
gloss: the act of (doing), …ing [sometimes pejorative].

sentence: 누구도 감당할 수가 없는 건가 봐요.
here: …it seems like it is something that not everyone can cope with.
gloss: = 아무도 no one, nobody; not one.

here: …lit. if things were like they used to be…
gloss: if it were/be/had been…

here: …we haven’t even gone half-way.
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern in -지 못한다.

here: …he laughed out loud.
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: …in a quivering voice…
gloss: seems to be …ing; as (if) …ing; does as (if).

here: …it continued in the direction of the mountain.
gloss: resultant state: is in the state of resulting from, is done. Note also –어진다 on 잇다, 이어요 continue.

here: …a heart-chilling kind of tension…
gloss: seems to be …ing; as (if) …ing; does as (if).

here: …nothing was to be seen
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern in -지 않는다.

here: he’s passed by here.
gloss: For 여기를.

here: he spoke while lifting and setting his trousers.
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously. Note also naked infinitive from -어(서).

here: …just as Mr. Yang showed us,…
gloss: as, just as, just as it is (was); in accordance with.

here: practically running…
gloss: Usually treated by Korean grammarians as an unanalyzed ending -다사피. In a way that tends to do, in a way inclined toward doing, in a way such that it is possible/likely; in a way that is virtually in accordance with, practically, virtually, as much as to do, almost, as if to, “like-to”. Note also naked infinitive in -어(서).

here: [Mr. Yang’s] pace was extremely fast.
gloss: similar in effect to the pattern 여간 + NEGATIVE (or implied negative): very; not a little, to no small extent, quite, extremely, terribly.

here: …our entire bodies getting clawed at by the thorns and branches,…
gloss: To mark the (inanimate) agent of a passive. That is, 에 marks the ‘by’-phrase in a passive construction. Note also dialect/substandard passive 할키우- related to standard 할퀴-.

here: We tumbled over forwards and backwards many a time.
gloss: [엎어지고 자빠지고] as subject (unmarked).

here: …I was unaware of the fact that I was hurt.
gloss: did not know/was not aware that....

here: …we were way past the point of exhaustion, but…
gloss: after, past, beyond.

here: …we had no thoughts of sleep.
gloss: deletion of [하지] after verbal noun: for 생각을 [하지] 않았다.

here: …any minute…
gloss: (1) even if (it be); (2) just, (or the ) like ( = 이나 ); or even; any, some, here on locative 에.

here: …we sat at the clearing on the ridge and looked around
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: …as if [the tiger] would appear any second.
gloss: (1) even if (it be); (2) just, (or the ) like ( = 이나); or even; any, some, here on locative 에.

here: …he said, chewing on dried squid.
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

sentence: 관목 숲에서 눈을 떼지 않은 채 물었다.
here: …he asked, without taking his eyes off the shrubbery.
gloss: just as it is or did, (in) the original state of…

here: …using his two arms as a pillow…
gloss: by way of NOUN, for NOUN, for the sake of NOUN, as a NOUN (from 삼다 make something of (a person or a thing).

here: …I believed that the tiger would come over to us.
gloss: will probably be/do, usually quoting an internal thought.

here: …swift, magical mountain beast…
gloss: abbreviated from -스러운 from -스럽다 like, as.

here: …I believed that it would come running in front of us.
gloss: For 것이라[고].

here: …it was also an earnest belief.
gloss: also is, is also.

here: …even though it was way past the time…
gloss: given the circumstance that it is/does, even though, though. This pattern can usually be taken as an abbreviation of -는데도 불구하고 in spite of the fact that.

here: …there was not a tiger in sight.
gloss: not VERB at all, not VERB in the least. Note also negative preemphasis in -지를 않-. The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern.

here: …those were Mr. Yang’s relaxed words.
gloss: (characterized) by NOUN (for nouns ending in a vowel). Parallels –답다 (for nouns ending in a consonant).

here: …convincing words…
gloss: is sufficient (to do), is well worth (doing); is at the point (of doing), has reached the stage (when it can do).

here: …I did not have…
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern in -지 못한다.

here: …I did not know exactly …
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern in -지 못한다.

here: …almost jokingly…
gloss: like, as, giving the appearance of…; appearing (to be), looking (like); seeming as if; as if/though.

here: …entertaining himself.
gloss: Used with descriptive verbs that refer to human feelings (liking, fearing, reacting to…) when the experiencer is a third person. Here on NOUN(에) + 겹다 be too much for one; be extreme, excessive.

here: …I was happy the way I was.
gloss: adverbial 이대로 as subject.

here: …sitting among the mountains…
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: …taking in the translucent autumn light…
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: …watching over ridge and forest…
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: …a secretive being…
gloss: abbreviated from -스러운 from -스럽다 be like, as.

here: …It was a state of mind completely removed from this world.
gloss: resultant state: is in the state of resulting from, is done.

here: …gazing at the cliff…
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously.

here: …they were in the same state of mind as myself.
gloss: is like, is as (if) is like, is as (if).

here: …like children that have come out to play…
gloss: =처럼 like

here: …there was not a trace left on Mr. Yang’s countenance.
gloss: The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern in -지 않는다.

here: …[Mr. Ha] seemed no different from a mountain wizard.
gloss: be no different from NOUN, be just like NOUN.

here: …went so far as to dance up a storm.
gloss: even, so far as (extent, emphasis). Note also -어 댄다 (does) terribly, awfully, a lot, like mad/anything (gives iterative and/or emphatic force to a preceding verb infinitive).

here: (he was pointed at) by the entire village
gloss: from.

here: …he was pointed at and called a drunk (by the entire village)
gloss: the act of (doing), …ing (sometimes pejorative).

here: …looked so wonderful.
gloss: similar in effect to the pattern 여간 + NEGATIVE (or implied negative) meaning very; not a little, to no small extent, quite, extremely, terribly.

here: …after eating lunch…
gloss: after ...ing.

here: …I only felt like I wished he would disappear.
gloss: nothing but, only.

here: …to stay over a long time in the mountain…
gloss: Naked infinitive.

here: …even though K said he was leaving…
gloss: abbreviated from 간ㄷ[ㅏ고 ㅎ]ㅐ도 .

here: …to the extent that we forgot about the tiger…
gloss: in as much as, in so far as, since (had done/been).

here: …it went so far as to feel awkward.
gloss: in a way that went so far as being … with 까지even, so far as (extent, emphasis). Note also -어 진다: besides meaning gets to be or becomes with adjectives, can have the effect of a "get-passive" in English or of middles or reflexives in languages which have these. The implication is that the subject/agent is either (sometimes adversely) affected by the action, and/or has no control over the action of the verb.

here: …I didn’t even feel apologetic.
gloss: even, too, to boot, in addition, into the bargain. Note also negative preemphasis in -지를 않는다. The addition of 를 to -지 is thought to add emphasis, insistence or a hint of frustration to the long negation pattern.

here: …making each other laugh…
gloss: short for -(으)면서 while, at the same time, (doing) simultaneously. Note also 간지럼: abbreviated substantive from 간지러움 ← 간지럽다.

here: …laughed with tears in our eyes.
gloss: does repeatedly/continuously; does and does; keeps doing, does on and on, does (keeps doing)it away; does again and again, does over and over again.

sentence: 맘에 안 드는 녀석 하나를 골탕 먹이고 난 뒤와 같이
here: …as if we had just gotten rid of a guy we didn’t like…
gloss: after doing; ever since …ing.

sentence: 온 산이 불덩이 속에 든 듯
here: …as if the whole mountain were placed inside a fireball…
gloss: like, as, giving the appearance of...; appearing (to be), looking (like); seeming as if; as if/though.

here: …it felt like [the tiger] would come over.
gloss: is a feeling of… gives the feeling of… feels like…

here: …we didn’t even need binoculars.
gloss: even, too, to boot, in addition, into the bargain.

here: …his spots were extremely clear.
gloss: similar in effect to the pattern 여간 + NEGATIVE (or implied negative) meaning very; not a little, to no small extent, quite, extremely, terribly.

sentence: 양 씨가 내 손을 꼭 잡은 채 속삭였다.
here: …grasping my hand tightly, Mr. Yang whispered.
gloss: just as it is or did, (in) the original state of…
